Yeah, I mean, for SSZ transactions, this scheme would allow embedding the signed transaction as is, without converting. 
While the current EIP-6404 approach performs conversions on all transactions, even SSZ ones

author: etan_status
content: PartialContainer should be simple as well, if not even simpler, as implementations already know how to serialize containers. Will give it a shot though in remerkleable.

author: etan_status
content:
The serialization of this scheme is actually equivalent to the union, except it has a bitmask at the start instead of a type number.
For merkleization, the scheme ensures that common fields are colocated regardless of type number. 
Meaning, consuming merkle proofs no longer requires a giant switch statement to cover the various tree shapes, which is good for simple ZK schemes as well
